details:
#### Primary Objective:
Retrieve all information related to project management, team performance, technical strategy, resource allocation, and budget oversight to effectively lead an engineering team.

#### Core Information to Retrieve:
-   **Project Management:** Project plans, timelines, Gantt charts, roadmaps, milestones, deliverables, project status reports, sprint summaries.
-   **Team & Performance Management:** Team rosters, performance reviews, 1-on-1 meeting notes, OKRs (Objectives and Key Results), KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), professional development plans, hiring plans, headcount data.
-   **Technical Strategy & Architecture:** Technical roadmaps, system design documents, architectural decision records (ADRs), post-mortems, root cause analysis (RCA), technical debt logs, proof-of-concept (POC) summaries.
-   **Financials & Budgeting:** Departmental budgets, resource allocation reports, expense reports, vendor quotes, purchase orders, cost-benefit analysis.
-   **Process & Operations:** Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), incident reports, release notes, process improvement proposals, engineering best practices guides.
-   **Stakeholder Communication:** Executive summaries, stakeholder meeting minutes, quarterly business review (QBR) documents, cross-functional dependency lists.

#### Information to Ignore (Noise):
-   Line-by-line source code or individual code commits.
-   Detailed unit test logs or CI/CD pipeline execution logs.
-   Individual developer's raw technical notes or debugging logs.
-   Company-wide marketing materials or sales reports.
-   General IT support tickets or building maintenance notifications.
-   Corporate financial statements not specific to the engineering department.
